data.title: OBITUARIES: Tuesday, April 18, 2023
data.meta_description: Twila Lee Mahilani Kaopio, 61, Smiths Grove Brenda Louise Payne Pook, 82, Glasgow Donald 'Dude' R. Wilkerson, ...
data.text:
Twila Lee Mahilani Kaopio, 61, Smiths Grove

Brenda Louise Payne Pook, 82, Glasgow

Donald ‘Dude’ R. Wilkerson, 79, Glasgow

Twila Lee Mahilani Kaopio, 61, Smiths Grove

Twila Lee Mahilani Kaopio, 61, of Smiths Grove died April 14, 2023, as a result of an automobile accident. Born in Honolulu, Hawaii, to the late Charles and June Kaopio Ridgeway, she loved her native Hawaiian heritage and her family dearly.

She is survived by her husband, Joe Edwards; two children, Tiffany and Brian Edwards of California; two grandchildren, Kristopher Fuentes and Kamila Villar; two brothers, Charles Hook and Sirguy Kaopio; three sisters, Kiso Berton, Charity Kekauoha and Tammy Ridgeway; and numerous nieces and In addition to her parents, she is preceded in death by her sister, Treva Oland.

Funeral service is at 1 p.m. Wednesday, April 19, 2023, at Hatcher & Saddler Funeral Home, with cremation to follow. Visitation is from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.

In lieu of flowers, the family has requested donations be made to help offset funeral expenses.

Brenda Louise Payne Pook, 82, Glasgow

Brenda Louise Payne Pook, 82, of Glasgow died peacefully April 13, 2023, at the home she shared with her daughter in Nicholasville. Brenda was born Sept. 27, 1940, in Glasgow to the late Lottie Williams Payne and Carl Payne.

Six months ago, her husband Richard, the love of her life, passed away. We know he was anxiously waiting for her at heaven’s gate and finally they’re reunited again. They were inseparable in their journey of life, and now together forever.

The last six years of Richard and Brenda’s lives were spent living with their daughter, Charlanne, dividing the time between their much-loved home in Glasgow and Charlanne’s home in Nicholasville. The three were a very close-knit family and relished their precious time together.

Brenda was a loving wife, mother and friend to many. She was a well-known beautician for many years; she also helped the American Cancer Society start a Look Good, Feel Good program for female cancer patients in the area. Later, she and Richard started their second career in antiques; this was their passion. She was extremely knowledgeable, and many people sought her expertise. They had antique booths in multiple antique malls in Nashville and Glasgow. She and Richard also conducted many estate sales. She was a long-time member of the Glasgow Cumberland Presbyterian Church and loyal member of P.E.O. Chapter Y.

Brenda is survived by her loving daughter Charlanne Pook; sisters-in-law, Ann Payne, Dorothy Payne and Jessie Mattax; and other family members and many friends. She was preceded in death by her three brothers, Leroy, Dale, and Roger.

Funeral service is at 1 p.m. Saturday, April 22, 2023, at A.F. Crow & Son Funeral Home, with burial in Glasgow Municipal Cemetery. Visitation is from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday at the funeral home.

In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made to Bluegrass Care Navigators/Hospice, 1733 Harrodsburg Road, Lexington, KY 40504 or Glasgow Cumberland Presbyterian Church, 101 Cumberland St., Glasgow, KY 42141.

Donald ‘Dude’ R. Wilkerson, 79, Glasgow
